image_code:
// Fork of "fractal interiors" by peabrainiac. https://shadertoy.com/view/fd23R3
// 2021-06-16 16:00:38
// Original video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VqmsaW9SXbA

/*
 * A fractal I found on youtube a while ago and found quite interesting.
 * It is generated by iterating z'=log(-z)/log(z), and coloring each point
 * based on how quickly its derivative grows (since the orbit itself never
 * actually diverges to infinity).
 *
 * The shader displays an animation by default, but you can also explore
 * the fractal on your own by using WASD and the up and down arrow keys.
 * 
 * If you want to dig into the code, Buffer A contains the actual fractal-
 * related code, while Buffer B contains all of the controls, together
 * with a bunch of code that is currently unused and has just been copied
 * over from one of my previous shaders.
